item.title: ams issue email distro
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: AMS Issue

Revision History:
    2015-07-06 09:19:14 - Version 1 created by Paul Rigor

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

 amstier3@DELOITTE.com - AMS issue reporting distro.. 

 If you recieve an Oracle error when logging in through AMS (or suspect an AMS outage), then the error should be reported to the above email address.  CC Bishal.


=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: AMS module modifying post login URL
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)
=================================================

Subject: AWS - API Credentials

Revision History:
    2019-09-03 9:03 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Background: CS-6242

For Confluence, there is some post-login behavior that takes you to a the client's undesired URL after login. 

edit:
/appdata/atlassian/confluence/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/seraph-config.xml
change:
originalurl 
to 
your desired, hard coded URL. Note you will need to add the ascii characxters for https

Example: in the ticket the request was to change 
            <param-value>https://wcdams.hhs.gov?goto=${originalurl}</param-value>
to
            <param-value>https://wcdams.hhs.gov/?goto=https%3A%2F%2Fstage-wiki.cloud.hhs.gov</param-value>


=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of
CTAC.

item.title: AMS_configuration_for_JIRA
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: AMS Integration 

Revision History:
    20120-03-20 17:00:00 - Version 1 created by Andrew

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

This is a kb on how to integrate AMS into JIRA

Links:

CI:
 - hhs-jira-01.prod.hhs.local

- Prerequisites
N/A

- Details
You can find the jar files on hhs-jira-01.prod.hhs.local, as well as other jira or confluence instances. 


After installing JIRA, you will need to make the following changes:

- In the /appdata/atlassian/jira/conf/server.xml file, in the Service section, Connector:
       - change connectionTimeout to "60000"
       - add the following lines:
              scheme="https"
              proxyName="(desired url)"   ## i.e.: "tracker.cloud.hhs.gov"  
              proxyPort="443"


- In the /appdata/atlassian/jira/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/seraph-config.xml file, set the following params values as follows:
        <param-name>login.url</param-name>
        <param-value>https://wcdams.hhs.gov?goto=${originalurl}</param-value>

        <param-name>link.login.url</param-name>
        <param-value>https://wcdams.hhs.gov?goto=${originalurl}</param-value>

        <param-name>logout.url</param-name>
        <param-value>https://wcdsso.cloud.hhs.gov/openam/UI/Logout?goto=https://wcdams.hhs.gov/logout</param-value>

   - after the params sections, set the authenticator as follows:
        <authenticator class="com.ctacorp.identity.provider.seraph.AaronsAuthJira"/>



=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.

item.title: ams_jira_confiduration_04_23_2020
item.description:
# How to add AMS authentication feature to jira application #\
# This KB assumes that the jira application is already installed #\
\
#Files needed: \
- server.xml\
- seraph-config.xml\
- openssoclientsdk.jar\
- CTAC-seraph-provider-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar\
- AMConfig.properties\
- footer.vm\
\
1. Get required files\
#retrieve the required files from the S3 bucket. \
#below is the command to run from your local machine or on the desired server to get the required files \
\
aws-vault exec <your aws user> -- aws s3 cp s3://jira-ams-connection-files/jira-ams-config-files.tar.gz <download location>\
\
2. Ensure that you make a copy of the original files on the remote jira/confluence server to CYA(cover your ass).\
File locations (from: jira-test.dev.hhs.local)\
/appdata/jira/conf/server.xml\
/appdata/jira/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/seraph-config.xml\
/appdata/jira/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/openssoclientsdk.jar\
/appdata/jira/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/ctac-seraph-provider-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar\
/appdata/jira/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/AMConfig.properties\
/appdata/jira/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/templates/plugins/footer/footer.vm\
\
3.  Untar the jira-ams-config-files.tar.gz :\
tar -xvf jira-ams-config-files.tar.gz \
\
A. server.xml \
- Edit the \'93proxyName=\'93 value to resemble desired url \
- Ensure ownership is correct. \
- Ensure permission is correct. (should be 644)\
- cp to /appdata/jira/conf\
\
\
B. seraph-config.xml \
- Ensure ownership is correct. \
- Ensure permission is correct. (should be 644)\
- cp to /appdata/jira/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes\
- ensure the following params values are set - \
\
set the following params values as follows:\
        <param-name>login.url</param-name>\
        <param-value>https://wcdams.hhs.gov?goto=$\{originalurl\}</param-value>\
\
        <param-name>link.login.url</param-name>\
        <param-value>https://wcdams.hhs.gov?goto=$\{originalurl\}</param-value>\
\
        <param-name>logout.url</param-name>\
        <param-value>https://wcdsso.cloud.hhs.gov/openam/UI/Logout?goto=https://wcdams.hhs.gov/logout</param-value>\
\
   - after the params sections, set the authenticator as follows:\
        <authenticator class="com.ctacorp.identity.provider.seraph.AaronsAuthJira"/>\
\
\
C. openssoclientsdk.jar\
- Ensure ownership is correct. \
- Ensure permission is correct. (should be 644)\
- cp to /appdata/jira/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib\
\
D. ctac-seraph-provider-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar\
- Ensure ownership is correct. \
- Ensure permission is correct. (should be 644)\
- cp to /appdata/jira/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib\
\
E. footer.vm\
- Ensure ownership is correct.\
- Ensure permission is correct. (should be 644)\
- cp to /appdata/jira/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/templates/plugins/footer\
\
\
\
}```
